GCRF.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.9 Inertial Earth-centered frame aligned with Earth's center of mass.

ICRF.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.11 International Celestial Reference Frame based on distant quasars.

J2000.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.14 Classical J2000 inertial frame defined at epoch J2000.0.

J2000A.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.15 Updated J2000 frame using IAU2000A precession-nutation models.

EME2000.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.7 Earth Mean Equator frame at epoch J2000 used in orbit determination.

TEMEOFDATE.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.25 True Equator Mean Equinox of Date frame for satellite tracking.

GTOD.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.10 Greenwich True of Date: Earth rotation relative to celestial reference.

CIRS.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.4 Celestial Intermediate Reference System based on CIP and CIO.

MOD_EARTH.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.18 Mean of Date (MOD) Earth frame using IAU1976 precession.

MOD_CB.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.17 Mean of Date (MOD) celestial body frame evaluated at each epoch.

MOD_MOON.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.19 Mean of Date (MOD) Moon frame evaluated at each epoch.

TOD_EARTH.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.29 True of Date (TOD) Earth frame with polar motion included.

TOD_CB.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.28 True of Date (TOD) celestial body frame.

TOD_MOON.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.30 True of Date (TOD) Moon frame.

TOE_EARTH.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.32 True of Epoch (TOE) Earth frame at specific epoch.

TOE_CB.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.31 True of Epoch (TOE) celestial body frame at specific epoch.

TOE_MOON.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.33 True of Epoch (TOE) Moon frame at specific epoch.

EFG.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.6 Earth-Fixed Geocentric frame using geodetic coordinates.

FIXED_CB.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.8 Fixed frame of a celestial body.

FIXED_EARTH.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.39 Fixed Earth frame aligned with WGS84 ellipsoid.

DTRFYYYY.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.5 Dynamic Terrestrial Reference Frame for a given year (DTRFYYYY).

ALIGN_EARTH.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.2 Mean Earth Equator and Equinox (ALIGN_EARTH) frame.

ALIGN_CB.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.1 Mean Central Body Equator and Equinox (ALIGN_CB) frame.

B1950.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.2.3 Classical Besselian 1950 equator and equinox frame.

EQW_INERTIAL.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.3.1 Earth Equatorial Inertial frame aligned with J2000 epoch.

LVLH_INERTIAL.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.3.3 Local Vertical Local Horizontal inertial frame.

LVLH_ROTATING.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.3.2 Local Vertical Local Horizontal rotating frame.

NSW_INERTIAL.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.3.5 Normal along-track cross-track inertial frame.

NSW_ROTATING.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.3.4 Normal along-track cross-track rotating frame.

NTW_INERTIAL.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.3.7 Orbit normal Tangential cross-track inertial frame.

NTW_ROTATING.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.3.6 Orbit normal Tangential cross-track rotating frame.

PQW_INERTIAL.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.3.8 Perifocal frame aligned with orbit's perigee.

RSW_INERTIAL.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.3.10 Radial along-track cross-track inertial frame.

RSW_ROTATING.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.3.9 Radial along-track cross-track rotating frame.

TNW_INERTIAL.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.3.12 Transverse normal cross-track inertial frame.

TNW_ROTATING.description: OID: 1.3.112.4.57.3.11 Transverse normal cross-track rotating frame.

ECEF.description: Earth-Centered-Earth-Fixed: Rotates with Earth. X-axis at prime meridian, Y eastward, Z towards North Pole.

TEME.description: True Equator Mean Equinox of Date, same as TEMEOFDATE: Dynamic frame for SGP4 satellite tracking.

TEMEOFEPOCH.description: True Equator Mean Equinox of Epoch: Static version of TEMEOFDATE at a given epoch.

ENU.description: East-North-Up: Local tangent plane for surface points.

NED.description: North-East-Down: Aviation/navigation frame aligned with gravity.

NEU.description: North-East-Up: Local tangent plane variant with Up positive.

RIC.description: Radial-Intrack-Cross-track: Spacecraft orientation aligned with orbit.

RTN.description: Radial-Transverse-Normal: Orbit frame for spacecraft dynamics.

VVLH.description: Vehicle-Velocity-Local-Horizontal: Orbit frame aligned with velocity vector.

LTP.description: Local Tangent Plane: Surface-fixed frame centered on a point.

LVLH.description: Local Vertical-Local Horizontal: Z axis towards Earth center, X along velocity.

BRF.description: Body-Fixed Reference Frame: Fixed to a spacecraft or celestial object.
